definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint

sentences.english: When sampling of 24 batch all qualified.
sentences.chinese: 當時抽檢的24個批次全部合格。

sentences.english: Randomly sampling at least 10 personnels from the different station of the production line.
sentences.chinese: 在生產線的不同站點，隨機抽檢十個員工。

sentences.english: The quality department strengthens to the SKD product assembly examination, enlarge spot-check quantity.
sentences.chinese: 品質部加強對SKD產品的裝配檢驗，加大抽檢數量。

sentences.english: In case of suspicions or irregularities an unannounced inspection may take place at any time.
sentences.chinese: 在懷疑或情況不規律，任何時候都可能會抽檢。

sentences.english: Can use the sample standard sampling.
sentences.chinese: 能使用抽樣標準進行抽檢。

definition: to test a random sample/to spot-check
to destroy (by melting or burning)/to obliterate
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to detect/to examine and discover/to sense
